title: Criticism of the Bible - Collection 33
description:
Criticism of the Bible - Collection 33:

We have 35 titles here:

-  Ashton - The Gospel of John and Christian Origins (2014)

-  Brettler et al - The Bible and the Believer; How to Read the Bible Critically & Religiously (2012)

-  Buth & Notley (Eds.) - The Language Environment of First Century Judaea; Jerusalem Studies in the Synoptic Gospels, Vol. 2 (2014)

-  Choi - Traditions at Odds; the Reception of the Pentateuch in Biblical and Second Temple Period Literature (2010)

-  Cook & Stipp (Eds.) - Text-Critical and Hermeneutical Studies in the Septuagint (2012)

-  Cotrozzi - Expect the Unexpected; Aspects of Pragmatic Foregrounding in Old Testament Narratives (2010)

-  de Vries & Karrer (Eds.) - Textual History and the Reception of Scripture in Early Christianity (2013)

-  DiTommaso & Turcescu (Eds.) - The Reception and Interpretation of the Bible in Late Antiquity (2008)

-  Ehrman & Holmes (Eds.) - The Text of the New Testament in Contemporary Research; Essays on the Status Quaestionis, 2e (2013)

-  Grabbe (Ed.) - Did Moses Speak Attic; Jewish Historiography and Scripture in the Hellenistic Period (2001)

-  Horsley - Jesus and Magic; Freeing the Gospel Stories from Modern Misconceptions (2014)

-  Kalimi et al (Eds.) - Scriptural Authority in Early Judaism and Ancient Christianity (2013)

-  Koester - From Jesus to the Gospels; Interpreting the New Testament in Its Context (2007)

-  Kotze - The Qumran Manuscripts of Lamentations; a Text-Critical Study (2013)

-  Lang - The Complete Book of Bible Secrets and Mysteries (2005)

-  Levin - Re-Reading the Scriptures; Essays on the Literary History of the Old Testament (2013)

-  Matthews & Benjamin - Old Testament Parallels; Laws and Stories from the Ancient Near East (2006)

-  Moberly - Genesis 12-50 (1995)

-  Neagoe - The Trial of the Gospel; an Apologetic Reading of Luke's Trial Narratives (2004)

-  Oswalt - The Bible Among the Myths; Unique or Just Different (2009)

-  Otero & Morales (Eds.) - Textual Criticism and Dead Sea Scrolls Studies in Honour of Julio Trebolle Barrera (2012)

-  Paine - Age of Reason; the Definitive Edition (2014)

-  Patrick - Andrew of Bethsaida and the Johannine Circle; the Muratorian Tradition and the Gospel Text (2013)

-  Patterson - The Gospel of Thomas and Christian Origins; Essays on the Fifth Gospel (2013)

-  Robinson - The Nag Hammadi Story; from the Discovery to the Publication (2014)

-  Rowland & Morray-Jones - The Mystery of God; Early Jewish Mysticism and the New Testament (2009)

-  Safer - Cain's Legacy; Liberating Siblings from a Lifetime of Rage, Shame, Secrecy and Regret (2012)

-  Seitz & Richards (Eds.) - The Bible as Christian Scripture; the Work of Brevard S. Childs (2013)

-  Stott - Why Did They Write This Way; Reflections on References to Written Documents in the Hebrew Bible and Ancient Literature (2008)

-  Tawil & Schneider - Crown of Aleppo; the Mystery of the Oldest Hebrew Bible Codex (2010)

-  Taylor - Studies in the Early Text of the Gospels and Acts (2013)

-  Thelle et al (Eds.) - New Perspectives on Old Testament Prophecy and History (2015)

-  Thompson - The Mythic Past; Biblical Archaeology and the Myth of Israel (1999)

-  Watson - Gospel Writing; a Canonical Perspective (2013)

-  York - The Last Shall Be First; the Rhetoric of Reversal in Luke (2015)
